I'm losing the will to live here, and can feel all my enthusiasm being drained away.

How the heck do I interact with objects?

In this tutorial, he has a page where he can add the message to be displayed if someone sits on an armchair, but I don't have that option.

My character is in a bathroom and there's a razor on the shelf. I want him to be able to shave, so that when he types 'use razor' he gets the message, "Clean shaven now, you feel surprisingly refreshed and ready for the day, but I can't find anywhere that will allow me to type this message.

I have created the razor as an object, and set the 'look', 'take', and 'drop' responses, but where and how do I set the 'use' parameters?

Posts.EditableText:
Steps to use an object:
1) Click on the object to highlight it.
2) Select its Features tab.
3) Check "Use/Give". A "Use/Give" tab will then appear.
4) You can now specify the behavior for the object either on its own (use razor) or in relation to other objects (use hatchet on door).

Now for your case, click the action for "Use (on its own)" and change it to "Run script". Then you can add a "print message" to have it print your message.
